result.execSummary:
All charges against Stanley D Pippion in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stanley D Pippion is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stanley D Pippion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stanley D Pippion in court.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Stanley D Pippion.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. State moves to Dismiss case, for reasons placed on the record. Court granted State's motion; case dismissed without prejudice. Any bail on deposit remaining balance to be returned to the provider.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Stanley D Pippion not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, with the exception of crime lab reports. State counsel further informs court that crime lab analysis is done at the directive of scheduling a trial date due to the Wisconsin State Crime lab backlog. Court schedules Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates and sets the following deadlines: 08/31/2022 deadline for the exchange of outstanding discovery material including crime lab reports. 10/14/2022 deadline for filing any trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Stanley D Pippion not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 033554,
Payable Number: 997928,
Receipt Number: 22RP013971,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Stanley D Pippion in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Stanley D Pippion in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Benitez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Stanley D Pippion not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Defense requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stanley D Pippion not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.



Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Stanley D Pippion in court with attorney Erin Michelle Karshen.  Defendant Stanley D Pippion in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
